rooms.description: A small entry hall connecting front door to main living areas. Designed with raw concrete finishes and robust steel elements as per Brutalist style.
Large open living area combining family room, dining space. Emphasizes brutalist design with exposed concrete columns and textured surfaces. Vastu compliant placement to invite positive energy.
Functional kitchen integrated into the living area. Features raw concrete counters, industrial lighting. Designed per local norms with proper ventilation.
Adjacent to the kitchen for ease of serving meals. Incorporates robust structural features and minimalistic Brutalist design.
Primary ground-floor bathroom with water-efficient fixtures and exposed concrete walls, ensuring privacy while adhering to local building norms.

openings.description: Heavy duty steel door complementing the brutalist aesthetic.
Large window to allow natural light and cross ventilation, while considering Vastu principles with east direction for auspicious energy.
